title: GSA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Met with the department head. Talked and then asked about my work in math. The course work that has been done and what classes I am going to take that will help with the position.
Interview Questions: Prove this integral and derivative

title: Residence Life Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Highly inclusive of all relevant departments and very transparent regarding difficulties in the position. Having all departments ask their own questions from the perspective in which you would interact with them in the role was very useful.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a stressful situation?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology (Melbourne, FL)
Interview Descriptions:
Applying via email -(3 months)- Phone interview -(1 month)- On-campus interview -(1 week)- Offer.
Very convenient to apply and they made a very quick decision after the on-campus interview, though the screening process took a long.
Interview Questions:
Why FIT?
Research plan

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great. It was easily set up through email. When I arrived I was greeted with a tour of the facility then a brief meeting.  The interview was relaxed and easy going.
Interview Questions: What makes you the best candidate for a research assistant over others?

title: Conference Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology (Melbourne, FL) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: A relatively short interview with the person who became my boss and one other staff member. Ask questions similar to those that I had answered before on a questionnaire. After the interview I was told that I would be contacted in about a week with either an offer or a rejection, via email or phone.
Interview Questions: How I would handle a situation when if required to do something that I would not normally be allowed to do.

title: College Dining Hall Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology (Melbourne, FL) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Questions about how passionate for the job i was were asked. How dedicated i will be for the job and how clean i stay everyday and how hygienic I am.
Interview Questions: How many straight hours can you work?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology (Melbourne, FL) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Professor approached me about his research based on a project I completed in one of his courses. We sat down and spoke about the research and if it was beneficial to my future.
Interview Questions: What would you like to gain from this research experience?

title: Graduate Student Service Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology (San Francisco, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was an initial phone screening from the HR department to know a little bit about me, the past university experience, and to confirm the applicant's interest in the position as they listed. They called on the cell phone during regular business hours to ask to speak for five minutes.
Interview Questions: What type of previous university experience do you have?

title: Public Service Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology (Melbourne, FL) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and had an on-site interview with the head of the department. Mostly HR related questions and STAR troupe questions. Overall, not a very tough interview process at all.
Interview Questions:
How do you manage conflicts?
Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview process at the Floridda Tech , the recruitment occurs through the application directly online. The online question consists of self-identification , the GRE pointers and IELTS pointers.
Interview Questions: What is your work experience?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology (Melbourne, FL)
Interview Descriptions: It took more than 3 applications and more than two months to get an interview.  The applications ask how much I am looking to make; but the two interviews I was called in for were paying less than requested (less than needed).
Interview Questions: Job Salary: (fill in the blank) -- I am not asking for much, but I need to make at least $12/hour.

title: Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology (Melbourne, FL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Positive and influential discussion with hiring manager. The interview was timely and lasted approximately 1 hour. The HR Team was helpful and answered all my questions. The hiring manager was polite and easy to communicate with.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to travel?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Easy personal interview. All questions were based on my experience. None of the usual awkward questions. Was invited to two one on one interviews. This was a very easy and smooth process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Once you are selected for the interview, you will be interviewed by group of people. You will be asked what your actions would be in different situations that would come up.
Interview Questions: What would you do if there was a person with a gun in the gym while you are working?

title: Graduate Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Offer was received along with graduate admission offer. No interview was required.
Interview Questions: No interview was required.

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology (Melbourne, FL) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met with team, interviewed by director and team. They phone screened first, and then in person there were four one-on-one's and then I met with the entire team in a panel format.
Interview Questions: What would you do to make a difference here

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology (Melbourne, FL) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Just walk in and have a conversation with head of department. The head is very kindness and friendly. He just ask which professor I will work for and whats my study plan in the future. The process is very easy and relaxed
Interview Questions: Just ask something about TOEFL score and GPA.

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology (Melbourne, FL) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and emailed in my Resume, and when I came in to interview, I answered some general questions about my self, what I'm studying, what I'd be able to tutor in. Then I explained a math problem the way I would explain it to a student to show my ability to tutor..
Interview Questions: Can you explain this math problem to me?

title: Dining Hall Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: No interview process. If you are a student or know someone who works there, you will get hired. You could be a complete drugged out dope. They will still hire you. They love cheap labor.
Interview Questions: No interview questions. They just ask about your availability.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward. They sent me an assignment of sorts, which I had to complete in a specified amount of time. I learned what I needed to learn, and got it done
Interview Questions: build a web app to design

title: Financial Aid Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Completed on-line application and submitted resume. About two months later, received a phone call from supervisor, a month later, another phone call. About a week later, face to face interview with two supervisor, introduction to staff and shown around the Financial Aid Department.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Facilities Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology (Melbourne, FL) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I posted resume on the company website and filled out their application. Received call in a week for interview. Just 1 in person interview.2 interview conductors and received job offer in about 1 week.
Interview Questions: What previous experience did I have?

title: Admission Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology (Melbourne, FL) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line and heard within 2 weeks.  I was interview by my co-workers and my boss.  I heard back within 2 weeks and I started a month later.  The process was easy and very well managed.  Communicaton was excellent.
Interview Questions: HOw woudl you convinve a studne tto coem here vs anothe rbig name school.

title: Graduate Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology (Melbourne, FL) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly laid back, but it depends on your department and your advisor. If you were already accepted as a graduate student, then you have already showed them that you have the skills and determination to be there. For teaching however, you need to have some background and be comfortable with the topics that you will be teaching, and dealing with students at a private university.
Interview Questions: Will you be comfortable instructing students that may be your same age or older?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology (Melbourne, FL) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: My adviser hired me
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Onsite Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida Institute of Technology (Melbourne, FL) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Talked to the head of the Academic Support Center and was told to fill out a single piece of paper. I was called the next day to put my hours in.
Interview Questions: They needed to ask my current professors what they thought of my understanding of the information they teach in lecture.
